technology.name: Wakhaf of the First Dynasty
technology.description: Wakhaf repelled the nomads and secured the borders. He is a peerless master of desert warfare.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Wakhaf to your faction's Lord pool (on foot with dual swords)

technology.name: Rakhash of the Second Dynasty
technology.description: Conquering lands beyond the mountains east of Nehekhara, Rakhash was a bringer of great prosperity.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Rakhash to your faction's Lord pool (on steed with sword and halberd )

technology.name: Thutep of the Third Dynasty
technology.description: The son of Khetep ruled only briefly before his death, but his grasp of engineering and urban development were legendary.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Thutep to your faction's Lord pool (on warsphinx)

technology.name: Lahmizzash of the Fourth Dynasty
technology.description: Lahmizzash continued the fight against Nagash, retaking sacred Khemri with the aid of his potent Ushabti.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Lahmizzash to your faction's Lord pool (on foot with bow)

technology.name: Setep of the Fifth Dynasty
technology.description: Ruling in the wake of the war with Nagash, Setep restored the Necropolis and the Priesthood to their former glory.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Setep to your faction's Lord pool (on steed with sword and staff )

technology.name: Alkhazzar II of the Sixth Dynasty
technology.description: This warrior-king was unmatched in chariot tactics. Only the finest crews served under him - and will again, of courseâ€¦

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Alkhazzar II to your faction's Lord pool (on chariot with halberd and shield)
Ability: "Avatar of the Gods" for Ushabti and Ushabti (Great Bow) units
Cooldown: -50% to "Avatar of the Gods" for Ushabti and Ushabti (Great Bow) units

technology.name: Priesthood of Ptra
technology.description: Ptra is the Sun-God, and first of the pantheon.

technology.name: Apprenticeship of Beka
technology.description: Beka of Lybaras was chosen as the architect of Khalida's tomb, which was an honour befitting his skill.

technology.name: Patronage of Khetep
technology.description: Patronage of Khetep of the Third Dynasty, bringer of prosperity.

technology.name: Apprenticeship of Hemiunus
technology.description: A ruthless slave-driver, Hemiunus was famed for raising the glittering Temple of Sorrow in record time.

technology.name: Priesthood of Sokth
technology.description: Sokth is the God of Thieves, Scorpions and Poison.

technology.name: Patronage of Alkhazzar
technology.description: Patronage of Alkhazzar II of the Sixth Dynasty; he who brought Numas to heel.

technology.name: Herald of Rasetra
technology.description: Knowing precisely where to place the killing blow, Rasetra's Crocodile Squadron turned swordplay into an art form.

effects.description: Grants the Herald of Rasetra follower to your faction
Cooldown: -50% to "Memories of the Hunt" for Skeleton Archers and Skeleton Horsemen Archers units
Ability: "Sokth's Blessing" for Tomb Scorpion units
Cooldown: -50% to "Sokth's Blessing" for Tomb Scorpion units

technology.name: Apprenticeship of Pehenna
technology.description: A First Dynasty master mason, Pehenna single-handedly crafted the Charnel Valley statuary.

technology.name: Patronage of Queen Rasut
technology.description: Patronage of Queen Rasut of the Second Dynasty, exalter of the Priesthood.

technology.name: Priesthood of Djaf
technology.description: Djaf is the jackal-headed God of War and Death.

technology.name: Priesthood of Khsar
technology.description: Khsar is the God of the Desert and its wild winds.

technology.name: Patronage of Setep
technology.description: Patronage of Setep of the Fifth Dynasty, restorer of the Necropolis.

technology.name: Apprenticeship of Inenna
technology.description: Inenna the Silent oversaw the construction of Numas, the Scarab City.

technology.name: Herald of Djaf
technology.description: The Ushabti of Djaf's Messengers fought with legendary zeal, even as the odds against them grew.

effects.description: Grants the Herald of Djaf follower to your faction

Bound spell: "Gaze of Nagash"
	(all characters factionwide)

ui_effects.description: Strong vs single and multiple units

technology.name: Patronage of Wakhaf
technology.description: Patronage of Wakhaf of the First Dynasty, subjugator of nomads.

technology.name: Priesthood of Neru
technology.description: Neru, betrothed of Ptra, is Goddess of the Moon and the 'Great Protector'.

technology.name: Apprenticeship of Thutmosa
technology.description: Thutmosa's subtle artistry with chisel and mallet earned him the honour of sculpting Settra's throne.

technology.name: Patronage of Lahmizzash
technology.description: Patronage of Lahmizzash of the Fourth Dynasty, enemy of Nagash.

technology.name: Apprenticeship of Imhetop
technology.description: Imhetop was First Hammer of Bel-Aliad, City of Dust. Every building there bore his mark.

technology.name: Priesthood of Asaph
technology.description: Asaph is the Goddess of Magic and Vengeance.

technology.name: Herald of Mahrak
technology.description: With gilded bones and magically-honed blades, the Golden Host of Mahrak were the glory of the Third Dynasty.

effects.description: Grants the Herald of Mahrak follower to your faction
Causes attrition to enemy armies within your territory
Only one technology can be researched from this group, second will be locked!
Only one technology can be researched from this group, second will be locked!
Cooldown: -50% to "Remembered Dexterity" for Nehekhara Horsemen and Nehekhara Warriors units
Ability: "Warsphinx's Roar" for Khemrian Warsphinx units

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Warsphinx's Roar" for Khemrian Warsphinx units

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

technology.name: Wisdom of the First Dynasty
technology.description: Ruling from the glittering capital of Khemri, Settra bound the disparate Priest Kings into the unity of single kingdom and lo, Nehekhara was born.

effects.description: Melee defence: +2 for Skeleton Warriors and Spearmen units

technology.name: Wisdom of the Second Dynasty
technology.description: The Second dynasty marked a period of sweeping territorial expansion and growing prosperity for Nehekhara.

effects.description: Melee defence: +2 for Skeleton Warriors and Spearmen units

technology.name: Wisdom of the Third Dynasty
technology.description: The kingdom prospered further until Nagash's treacherous rise to power, although he was finally defeated by the united Priest Kings.

effects.description: Melee defence: +2 for Skeleton Warriors and Spearmen units

technology.name: Wisdom of the Fourth Dynasty
technology.description: In the aftermath of Nagash's reign of terror, king succeeded king in a period of great strife, division and civil war.

effects.description: Melee defence: +2 for Skeleton Warriors and Spearmen units

technology.name: Wisdom of the Fifth Dynasty
technology.description: King Setep usurped the throne of Khemri, restoring the Priesthood and the Necropolis; from then on, Nehekhara began to flourish once more.

effects.description: Melee defence: +2 for Skeleton Warriors and Spearmen units

technology.name: Wisdom of the Sixth Dynasty
technology.description: A resurgent Nehekhara reached its peak under Alcadizzar. Nagash returned, and after years of war, Nehekhara finally fell into decay.

effects.description: Melee defence: +2 for Skeleton Warriors and Spearmen units

technology.name: Herald of the Sphinx
technology.description: Beguiling and deceptive, the Sphinx Legion of Numas caught countless foes unprepared, even in the open field.

effects.description: Grants the Herald of the Sphinx follower to your faction

technology.name: The Heralds Empowered
technology.description: The envoys and harbingers of a Tomb King, bring about his benevolenceâ€¦ or wrath.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Liche High Priests
Recruit rank: +2 for Liche High Priests
Recruit rank: +3 for Liche High Priests
Recruit rank: +4 for Liche High Priests
Cooldown: -50% to "Nightmares Manifest" for Necrosphinx units

technology.name: Runic Inscriptions
technology.description: Through the ancient Necrotect runes inscribed on your marching drums, the Unliving may be driven to march at a greater pace.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10 for Nehekhara Warriors and Chariot units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Chariot units

technology.name: The Quickening
technology.description: This ancient Nehekharan incantation is capable of raising hosts from â€˜neath the sands, fully armed and charged with the foeâ€™s destruction.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10 for Skeleton Horsemen and Nehekharan Horsemen units
Ammunition: +10% for Skeleton Archers and Horsemen units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Skeleton Archers and Skeleton Horsemen units

technology.name: The Boon of Ualatp
technology.description: A ritual supplication to the vulture-headed God of Scavengers shall ensure his spawn make reliable allies.

effects.description: Armour-piercing weapon damage: +5 for Carrion units
Speed: +25% for Dire Wolves and Fell Bats units

technology.name: Pride in Service
technology.description: Though long dead, kingly guardians can be reminded of their oaths of service made in ages past, invigorating them for battle.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Tomb Guard units
Melee defence: +4 for Tomb Guard units

technology.name: Ancient Battle Sites
technology.description: Studying the splendid cartography of the Fifth Dynasty shows you exactly where to source veteran stock.

effects.description: Ammunition: +20% for Screaming Skull Catapult and Casket of Souls units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Skull Catapult and Casket of Souls units

technology.name: Clothed in the Divine
technology.description: Trinkets and ritual masks bearing Ptra's sigil are bestowed upon your stone guardians, making them fight all the harder.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Ushabti and Ushabti (Great Bow) units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Ushabti units

technology.name: Herald of Zandri
technology.description: With the Vulture-God Ualatp at their backs, the Zandri Blackshields drove their chariots with preternatural speed.

effects.description: Grants the Herald of Zandri follower to your faction

technology.name: The Ossuary Dirge
technology.description: A First-Dynasty graveyard chant has been discovered, imbuing Skeleton Warriors with greater agility in battle.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Nehekhara Warriors and Chariot units
Melee defence: +4 for Nehekhara Warriors and Chariot units

technology.name: Nomad Stock
technology.description: Raising elite riders and their steeds from Second Dynasty nomadic battle sites bolsters your cavalry forces.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Skeleton Horsemen and Nehekhara Horsemen units
Melee defence: +4 for Skeleton Horsemen and Nehekhara Horsemen units

technology.name: The Ritual of Sokth
technology.description: It is said that a drop of purest venom, placed upon the lips of the sacrificial victim, will rouse the Scorpion-God himself.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Tomb Scorpion units
Melee defence: +4 for Tomb Scorpion units

technology.name: Dark Brotherhood
technology.description: If they can disregard their former rivalries and toil together in common cause, Necrotects can achieve engineering wonders.

technology.name: Invocation of Qu'Aph
technology.description: A burnt offering, combined with the correct ritual address, brings great dexterity to a Necropolis Knight's mount.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Necropolis Knights units
Melee defence: +4 for Necropolis Knights units

technology.name: Underworld Gate
technology.description: Forbidden scrolls found in the deep desert reveal portals to Usirianâ€™s realm. This is where the Necrosphinx lurk, awaiting to be tethered to a dread statue.

technology.name: Herald of Khemri
technology.description: The arrows of the Hawk Legion of Khemri always found their mark at necks, groins and the tiniest chinks in enemy armour.

effects.description: Grants the Herald of Khemri follower to your faction
Missile resistance: 10% for all vampiric units
Weapon strength: +10% for all vampiric units
Diplomatic relations: +100 with Vampire Coast and Vampire Counts
Recruit rank: +2 for all vampiric units

Construction time: -10% for Ancient Kingdom buildings
Ability: "Journey from the Underworld" for Hierotitan units
Cooldown: -50% to "Journey from the Underworld" for Hierotitan units

technology.name: First Dynasty Plans
technology.description: Construction scrolls have been disinterred, making it possible to improve certain unitsâ€™ weapons and armour.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Nehekhara Warriors and Chariot units
Weapon strength: +10% for Nehekhara Warriors and Chariot units

technology.name: Bone Edifice
technology.description: As posited by Rakaph III, bone makes both an effective weapon and surprisingly durable armour for Undead warriors.

effects.description: Armour: +15 for Skeleton Archers and Horsemen units
Melee attack: +4 for Bone Giant units
Missile strength: +10% for Skeleton Archers and Horsemen units
Ward save: 5% for Bone Giant units

technology.name: Liche Administrators
technology.description: Mortuary Cult devotees know all about the most fruitful burial grounds. Assigned to garrison, such knowledge is invaluable.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Sepulchral Stalkers units
Melee defence: +4 for Sepulchral Stalkers units

technology.name: Stronger Binding
technology.description: With minor adjustments to everyday incantations, the dead may be made to rise with greater vigour than they ever knew in life.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Tomb Guard and Hierotitan units
Weapon strength: +10% for Tomb Guard and Hierotitan units

technology.name: Ancient Quarries
technology.description: Fifth Dynasty scrolls show the locations of Necroserpent nests, where the beasts sit coiled beneath the sands, on a bed of howling skulls.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Necropolis Knights units
Missile strength: +10% for Skull Catapult and Casket of Souls units

technology.name: The Lost Gold of Alkharad
technology.description: Huge Sixth Dynasty gold reserves have been recovered - perfect for ornamenting our most prestigious edifices.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for Khemrian Warsphinx units

technology.name: Herald of the Scorpion
technology.description: Blessed by Sokth himself, the Scorpion Guard could shrug off mortal blows and carve through infantry with horrifying efficiency.

effects.description: Grants the Herald of the Scorpion follower to your faction

technology.name: Proclamation of the First Dynasty
technology.description: March, my legions - plant the seeds of civilisation upon the lands of Nehek!

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Infantry and Chariot buildings

technology.name: Proclamation of the Second Dynasty
technology.description: From the sands come steed and shadow - the desert stables open to the gallop of death!

technology.name: Proclamation of the Third Dynasty
technology.description: Make ready our cities - build upon strong foundations so they stand the test of time!

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.name: Proclamation of the Fourth Dynasty
technology.description: Defend your kingdom and attack the weak. Glory is in victory at all costs.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Wall, Garrison, Citadel and Estate buildings
Income from sacking and looting settlements: +10%

technology.name: Proclamation of the Fifth Dynasty
technology.description: From the deserts the great shrines arise; larger and taller to withstand the winds of time and the usurpers of nascent kingdoms!

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for income, growth and public order buildings

technology.name: Proclamation of the Sixth Dynasty
technology.description: And the might of Nehekhara shall be unleashed - magic coils and the legions rise!

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +10% when increasing
Construction cost: -10% for Construct recruitment buildings

Casualty replenishment rate: +10%
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)
